Get Green Tips 5 fact :
Producing a single hamburger uses enough fossil fuel to drive a small car 20 miles and enough water for 17 showers.
tip :
Why not order a veggie burger instead? They're just as tasty, and every little bit helps when it comes to reducing your carbon footprint. Plus, you might even be able to afford some onion rings!
Source : http://www.peta2.com Posted by one world vegetarian at 10:29 AM 0 comments Email This BlogThis! Share to Twitter Share to Facebook Labels: Tips and Tricks Get Green Tips 4 fact :
Farmed animals use more than half the water consumed in the U.S.
tip :
Save water by eating more vegetarian meals. If you eat meat, set a goal of substituting vegetarian dishes for meat dishes for at least three meals every week. If you're vegetarian, try substituting a vegan dish for three meals every week. It gets easier with time: We promise!
Source : http://www.peta2.com Posted by one world vegetarian at 10:27 AM 0 comments Email This BlogThis! Share to Twitter Share to Facebook Labels: Tips and Tricks Get Green Tips 3 fact :
Every minute, about 1 million new plastic bags are used globally, which results in 2.2 billion gallons of wasted oil every year.
tip :
Bring a canvas tote bag every time you shop! Don't have a tote? Help the planet and show some peta2 love by getting our "Meat's Not Green" tote bag here!
Source : http://www.peta2.com Posted by one world vegetarian at 10:24 AM 0 comments Email This BlogThis! Share to Twitter Share to Facebook Labels: Tips and Tricks Get Green Tips 2 fact :
Seventy percent of the leveled rain forest in the Amazon is used to raise animals for meat consumption.
tip :
Try going vegetarian for a week. You'll help save the rain forests and feel healthier, and you might even want to stick with it once the week is over! If you're already vegetarian, try going vegan for a week!
Source : http://www.peta2.com Posted by one world vegetarian at 10:23 AM 0 comments Email This BlogThis! Share to Twitter Share to Facebook Labels: Tips and Tricks Get Green Tips 1 fact :
Every second, animals raised for food in the U.S. produce 89,000 pounds of waste: That's 130 times more than is produced by the country's entire human population. Now that's a lot of poop!
tip :
Reduce the poop! Go veg! To help you out, order a free copy of our "Vegetarian Starter Kit," which is full of recipes and other info to get you started. Did we mention that it also comes with free stickers and a DVD with band interviews?
